intro: Galium mollicomum var. friesiorum, commonly known as the soft-stemmed bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate structure and flowering habit make it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
